image.altText: Exterior of pizza shop with sunset in background

props.synopsis: Frontline services are warning Katherine women are among the "least safe in the country" after the deaths of two women, and the hospitalisation of two others, in the past few months.Â

title.children: 'Least safe in the country': Frontline services sound alarm over Katherine DV crisis

image.altText: A hand holds a mobile phone with the screen showing several social media apps

props.synopsis: Social media platforms will bear the onus of enforcing the federal government's age limit, not parents, the communications minister has confirmed.

title.children: Minister says platforms, not parents, will be responsible for the social media age limit

image.altText: Two men walk through a field on a farm with blue sky.

props.synopsis: ACTU president Michele O'Neil is calling on the government to reform a temporary working visa scheme that prevents workers leaving bad bosses and to blacklist dodgy employers who use migration worker exploitation as a business model.

title.children: A temporary working visa scheme slammed as a 'modern day slavery risk' urgently needs overhauling, advocates say

image.altText: A middle-aged white woman with a black blazer and glasses sitting in a courtyard

props.synopsis: The national children's commissioner and justice groups have warned against the Northern Territory government's plan to lower the age of criminal responsibility, saying it is "not based on evidence". It comes as the Australian Human Rights Commission recommends a national approach to youth justice.

title.children: 'Australia is out of step': Calls for national approach to youth justice as NT prepares to lower age

image.altText: A man in sunglasses stands before a large boat on a sunny day

props.synopsis: Sentencing for a man who pleaded guilty to smuggling in Brazilian divers to retrieve a cocaine stash in Newcastle will be pushed back as a judge orders a contested facts hearing.

title.children: Cocaine and people smuggler still waiting to learn fate as sentencing delayed

image.altText: A family at Uluru

props.synopsis: The Clausens are one of many Australian families hitting the road and homeschooling their kids along the way. They're part of a growing trend of families moving away from mainstream education.

title.children: Travel schooling is growing in popularity. Ali and Aaron say it's helped their son 'come alive'

image.altText: Empty liquor bottles and cans lay in the dry Todd River.

props.synopsis: People drinking alcohol in public could be fined more than $900 and arrested under new "nuisance public drinking" rules set to become law in the Northern Territory next week.

title.children: NT police will soon have powers to fine and arrest people for illegal public drinking. Here's how the laws will change

image.altText: Smiling man and woman in akubara, child sits on slide, baby in woman's arms, houses and lawn behind.

props.synopsis: This family lives a bumpy four-hour drive away from medical help. They couldn't do it without the Royal Flying Doctors Service.

title.children: When Lil started bleeding on her bathroom floor, help was hours away. Then the flying doctors arrived

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis vial

props.synopsis: The father of a man who took his own life after being prescribed medicinal cannabis says his family was repeatedly sent more cannabis, despite notifying the telehealth platform of his death.

title.children: Medicinal cannabis doctors investigated by authorities after suicide and hospitalisation of patients

image.altText: A teen girl sitting in front of a pink wall

props.synopsis: Now 13, Hiba dreams of being able to go to school, like other girls her age. Instead she sits on the side of the road, surrounded by bombed and broken houses, selling handmade bracelets.Â

title.children: Inside the life of a 13 year-old girl trying to survive 'a war of hell'

image.altText: Foreign minister Penny Wong faces the media in Adelaide. 2024-04-06 10:04:00

props.synopsis: Seats are still available on flights departing on Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

title.children: Australian government no longer scheduling flights out of Lebanon

image.altText: People gather in front of a destroyed building in Lebanon.

props.synopsis: Israel has launched a deadly air strike on central Beirut, while its ground troops in Lebanon have been accused of firing on the UN peacekeeping headquarters.

title.children: Israel strikes central Beirut, killing 22 and injuring 117

image.altText: a woman looks serious as she speaks to a camera in a corridor of parliament house.

props.synopsis:
Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek has given the reasons for a decision that has stalled a $1bn NSW gold mine, finding "permanent loss" of cultural heritage outweighed the financial cost of stalling the project.

Â

title.children: Billion-dollar gold mine would cause 'irreversible' damage to Aboriginal heritage, says Plibersek

image.altText: Man suspended from a cable attached to a helicopter hovering over the ocean , approaching a man holding on an esky in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Clinging to debris, an esky in the ocean and staying put on a boat are some of the many ways Floridians rode out Hurricane Milton,

title.children: How Americans 'hung on for dear life' as Hurricane Milton ripped through Florida

image.altText: A composite image of a man and a woman

props.synopsis: The final stretch of a heated election campaign is being marked by a spat over hurricane funding, disinformation, and a surprise announcement from Melania Trump. But will it change the outcome of the race?

title.children: Melania's bombshell, hurricanes, and disinformation: The home stretch of the US race gets chaotic

image.altText: Ms Kirkland refused to answer a range of questions about abortion as she was quizzed about her views

title.children: 'We have ruled it out': LNP candidate sidesteps questions about abortion stance during exchange with reporters

image.altText: Clayton Oliver in action for Melbourne

props.synopsis: Melbourne hits back at speculation Clayton Oliver has taken matters into his own hands, as the premiership Demon's playing future remains clouded. Follow live for all the updates on day five of the AFL trade period.

title.children: Demons respond to Oliver exit rumour, as shock pick swap lights up trade period

image.altText: A view of a New Zealand Navy vessel on fire as seen from the Samoan coast

props.synopsis: The Manawanui, the New Zealand Navy's specialist dive and hydrographic vessel, sank at a reef off the coast of Samoa that it was surveying.

title.children: NZ defence minister hits out at 'armchair admirals' trolling female captain of sunken navy ship

image.altText: A live sports betting site on a mobile phone, April 24, 2020.

props.synopsis: When the prime minister answered a question about protecting children from gambling harm he gave statistics that mystified experts and advocates. The source of the figures remains a mystery.

title.children: A mystery gambling statistic has entered our debate, and no one knows where it came from

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone in a studio.

props.synopsis: The long-time Drive presenter tells listeners he has "hogged" the role for long enough and will be leaving ABC Radio Sydney in November.

title.children: After 26 years in 'one of the best jobs' in Australian journalism, Richard Glover is moving on

image.altText: A pink and yellow hue aurora in the night sky by the beach

props.synopsis: The aurora australis has returned, lighting up the skies in intense colours over southern states. If you missed out on seeing it last night you may get another chance.

title.children: 'Enchanting' aurora display wows photographers and stargazers

image.altText: A shoe on the floor of a kitchen is seen from up close

props.synopsis: Ecovacs robot vacuums in multiple US cities were hacked in the space of a few days, with the attacker physically controlling them and yelling obscenities through their onboard speakers.

title.children: Hackers take control of robot vacuums in multiple US cities and abuse owners

image.altText: Seven Network's logo on a building

props.synopsis: Amelia Saw, who worked for the network's Spotlight program, has taken the company to Federal Court alleging breaches of the Fair Work Act.

title.children: Seven asks for 'salacious' court documents to be kept secret after being sued by former journalist

image.altText: Silhouhette of a woman against a graphic background of red and blue, with a photo of a corridor in the background.

props.synopsis: The workplace safety regulator finds a new centre for women recovering from domestic, sexual and family violence in regional NSW has exposed its workers to "psychological injury", after the departure of most of its frontline staff.

title.children: Staff blow whistle on 'major' workplace safety concerns at Australian-first DV trauma recovery centre

image.altText: An Australian gymnast competing in 2018.

props.synopsis: Australia's Kate Sayer has achieved a significant distinction by having a skill named in her honour by the International Federation of Gymnastics.

title.children: 'The Sayer': Aussie gymnast recognised with skill named in her honour

image.altText: Illuminated logos of Coles and Woolworths outside of each supermarket in a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: The local share market loses ground, and major supermarket chains are grilled over why Tim Tams are cheaper in the UK than in Australia. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Coles, Woolworths grilled over pricing and landbanking by senators

image.altText: jonathan haidt

props.synopsis: American social psychologist Jonathan Haidt tells a gathering of policymakers and parents that Australia should set an example to the world by helping to "slay" the "monsters" created by his home country's social media giants, as state governments and the Commonwealth look to clamp down on largely unfettered access to online platforms among young children.

title.children: Renowned US author urges Australia to 'slay' the world's social media 'monsters', as children open up about harassment

image.altText: Headshot of a man wearing dark sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Maurizio Di Ciano, who once ran the restaurant at the WA Italian Club, sexually abused staff aged in their 20s and 30s who were all foreign nationals and recently employed by him.

title.children: Jail for prominent Perth chef and Italian restaurant owner who sexually assaulted three female workers

image.altText: A man with clothing over his head bends down as he enters a car, with two others walking with him.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man is charged with two counts of sexual intercourse without consent against a female ADFA student.

title.children: Man appears in court charged with raping fellow ADFA student

image.altText: A maroon car stopped in floodwaters. Palms trees in the background are being bent by the wind.

props.synopsis: Ahead of Hurricane Milton making landfall in Florida, fears swirled about EVs bursting into flames if inundated by a storm surge. We examine the facts.

title.children: Are EVs really 'ticking time bombs' in a hurricane?

image.altText: Craig Goodwin points to the sky

props.synopsis: The Socceroos have come from behind to beat China 3-1 at Adelaide Oval, handing Tony Popovic victory in his first match as coach.Â

title.children: Craig Goodwin's screamer gives Socceroos victory over China
